Articles.Content: According to the trailer, KSP 2 will be available on PC as well as consoles. Will the console and PC versions of the game be cross-compatible? (i.e you could transfer a PC save to console or play multiplayer on PC with console users)

2 hours ago, Clockwork13 said:

According to the trailer, KSP 2 will be available on PC as well as consoles. Will the console and PC versions of the game be cross-compatible? (i.e you could transfer a PC save to console or play multiplayer on PC with console users)

Probably, as source is the same save game will be identical. 
issue will be to transfer games as consoles tend to not like external files. 
One way to fix some Skyim bug was to take an save game from console, load it onto an pc version use console commands or an mod to fix it then back to console. 

Add that consoles become more and more like pc, this is likely to accelerate with next generation.
My main concern about multiplayer across platforms is mod support, as historically only PC releases allowed the use of mods, whereas consoles didn't.

2 hours ago, sumghai said:

My main concern about multiplayer across platforms is mod support, as historically only PC releases allowed the use of mods, whereas consoles didn't.

Best case scenario is that it will be like unturned that disables all of your mods temporary when you are on a server that doesn't have the mods you have installed (the game is aswell in unity so great!)

And who knows maybe they do something like paradox is doing that allows consoles to have mods!
